verses.verse: The words <S%H1697><s%> of the Preacher, <S%H6953><s%> the son <S%H1121><s%> of David, <S%H1732><s%> king <S%H4428><s%> in Jerusalem. <S%H3389><s%>
"Vanity <S%H1892><s%> of vanities, <S%H1892><s%>" says <S%H559><s%> the Preacher, <S%H6953><s%> "Vanity <S%H1892><s%> of vanities! <S%H1892><s%> All <S%H3605><s%> is vanity. <S%H1892><s%>"
What <S%H4100><s%> advantage <S%H3504><s%> does man <S%H120><s%> have in all <S%H3605><s%> his work <S%H5999><s%> Which <S%H7945><s%> he does <S%H5998><s%> under <S%H8478><s%> the sun <S%H8121><s%>?
A generation <S%H1755><s%> goes <S%H1980><s%> and a generation <S%H1755><s%> comes, <S%H935><s%> But the earth <S%H776><s%> remains <S%H5975><s%> forever. <S%H5769><s%>
Also, the sun <S%H8121><s%> rises <S%H2224><s%> and the sun <S%H8121><s%> sets; <S%H935><s%> And hastening <S%H7602><s%> to its place <S%H4725><s%> it rises <S%H2224><s%> there <S%H8033><s%> [again.]

Blowing <S%H1980><s%> toward <S%H413><s%> the south, <S%H1864><s%> Then turning <S%H5437><s%> toward <S%H413><s%> the north, <S%H6828><s%> The wind <S%H7307><s%> continues <S%H1980><s%> swirling <S%H5437><s%> along; <S%H1980><s%> And on its circular <S%H5439><s%> courses <S%H5439><s%> the wind <S%H7307><s%> returns. <S%H7725><s%>

All <S%H3605><s%> the rivers <S%H5158><s%> flow <S%H1980><s%> into the sea, <S%H3220><s%> Yet the sea <S%H3220><s%> is not full. <S%H4392><s%> To the place <S%H4725><s%> where <S%H7945><s%> the rivers <S%H5158><s%> flow, <S%H1980><s%> There <S%H8033><s%> they flow <S%H1980><s%> again. <S%H7725><s%>

All <S%H3605><s%> things <S%H1697><s%> are wearisome; <S%H3023><s%> Man <S%H376><s%> is not able <S%H3201><s%> to tell <S%H1696><s%> [it.] The eye <S%H5869><s%> is not satisfied <S%H7646><s%> with seeing, <S%H7200><s%> Nor <S%H3808><s%> is the ear <S%H241><s%> filled <S%H4390><s%> with hearing. <S%H8085><s%>

That which <S%H4100><s%> <S%H7945><s%> has been <S%H1961><s%> is that which <S%H7945><s%> will be, And that which <S%H4100><s%> <S%H7945><s%> has been done <S%H6213><s%> is that which <S%H7945><s%> will be done. <S%H6213><s%> So, there <S%H369><s%> is nothing <S%H369><s%> <S%H3605><s%> new <S%H2319><s%> under <S%H8478><s%> the sun. <S%H8121><s%>

Is there <S%H3426><s%> anything <S%H1697><s%> of which <S%H7945><s%> one might say, <S%H559><s%> "See <S%H7200><s%> this, <S%H2088><s%> it is new <S%H2319><s%>"? Already <S%H3528><s%> it has existed <S%H1961><s%> for ages <S%H5769><s%> Which <S%H834><s%> were before <S%H4480><s%> <S%H6440><s%> us.

There <S%H369><s%> is no <S%H369><s%> remembrance <S%H2146><s%> of earlier <S%H7223><s%> things; <S%H7223><s%> And also <S%H1571><s%> of the later <S%H314><s%> things <S%H314><s%> which <S%H7945><s%> will occur, <S%H1961><s%> There will be for them no <S%H3808><s%> remembrance <S%H2146><s%> Among <S%H5973><s%> those who <S%H7945><s%> will come <S%H1961><s%> later <S%H314><s%> [still.]
I, the Preacher, <S%H6953><s%> have been <S%H1961><s%> king <S%H4428><s%> over <S%H5921><s%> Israel <S%H3478><s%> in Jerusalem. <S%H3389><s%>

And I set <S%H5414><s%> my mind <S%H3820><s%> to seek <S%H1875><s%> and explore <S%H8446><s%> by wisdom <S%H2451><s%> concerning <S%H5921><s%> all <S%H3605><s%> that has been done <S%H6213><s%> under <S%H8478><s%> heaven. <S%H8064><s%> [It] is a grievous <S%H7451><s%> task <S%H6045><s%> [which] God <S%H430><s%> has given <S%H5414><s%> to the sons <S%H1121><s%> of men <S%H120><s%> to be afflicted <S%H9419><s%> with.

I have seen <S%H7200><s%> all <S%H3605><s%> the works <S%H4639><s%> which <S%H7945><s%> have been done <S%H6213><s%> under <S%H8478><s%> the sun, <S%H8121><s%> and behold, <S%H2009><s%> all <S%H3605><s%> is vanity <S%H1892><s%> and striving <S%H7469><s%> after wind. <S%H7307><s%>

What is crooked <S%H5791><s%> cannot <S%H3201><s%> <S%H3808><s%> be straightened, <S%H8626><s%> and what <S%H2642><s%> is lacking <S%H2642><s%> cannot <S%H3201><s%> <S%H3808><s%> be counted. <S%H4487><s%>

I said <S%H1696><s%> to myself, <S%H3820><s%> "Behold, <S%H2009><s%> I have magnified <S%H1431><s%> and increased <S%H3254><s%> wisdom <S%H2451><s%> more <S%H5921><s%> than <S%H5921><s%> all <S%H3605><s%> who <S%H834><s%> were over <S%H5921><s%> Jerusalem <S%H3389><s%> before <S%H6440><s%> me; and my mind <S%H3820><s%> has observed <S%H7200><s%> a wealth <S%H7235><s%> of wisdom <S%H2451><s%> and knowledge. <S%H1847><s%>"

And I set <S%H5414><s%> my mind <S%H3820><s%> to know <S%H3045><s%> wisdom <S%H2451><s%> and to know <S%H3045><s%> madness <S%H1947><s%> and folly; <S%H5531><s%> I realized <S%H3045><s%> that this <S%H2088><s%> also <S%H1571><s%> is striving <S%H7475><s%> after wind. <S%H7307><s%>

Because <S%H3588><s%> in much <S%H7230><s%> wisdom <S%H2451><s%> there is much <S%H7230><s%> grief, <S%H3708><s%> and increasing <S%H3254><s%> knowledge <S%H1847><s%> [results in] increasing <S%H3254><s%> pain. <S%H4341><s%>
